greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period of the fraction 1/3^n.
comment: The length of the period is the number of digits of a(n): 1, 1, 3, 9, 27, 81, ... The terms a(n) are more precisely the integers made from the digits of a period, starting with the first nonzero digit. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 23 2021
formula: a(n) = floor(10^(3^max(n-2,0)+L(3^n))/3^n) where L(m) = floor(log10(m)). - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 23 2021
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Mar 22 2002
